marginalia.translation: A man who is always prepared is always winged. This point.

position.marginalia_text: Vt perlarum magisterium extrahendum: sic omniu[m] memorabilium.

marginalia.translation: As teaching must be extracted from the [...], so too must it be extracted from all noteworthy things.

position.marginalia_text: Sera nimis vita est Crastina: viue hodiè.

marginalia.translation: A life tomorrow is too late: live today.

position.marginalia_text: { Ars, iuuenis: Virtus, vir: Furor ipse, Deus.

marginalia.translation: Art is a young man; virtue is an old man; fury itself is God.

position.marginalia_text: ) Viuat vir. Non Quis, sed quid.

marginalia.translation: Let man live. Not who, but what.

position.marginalia_text: Etiam maxima, magno actore minora. Qua[e] alijs grauissima, huic uni leuia.

marginalia.translation: Even the greatest things are lesser for a great actor. Those things which are heaviest for another are light for him alone.

position.marginalia_text: Qui non est hodiè, cras minùs aptus erit.

marginalia.translation: He who is not present today will be less capable tomorrow. "Never postpone": this motto made Alexander great.

position.marginalia_text: Homo est bestia, qui non se cogit quotidiè esse hominem.

marginalia.translation: A man is a beast if he does not force himself daily to be a man.

position.marginalia_text: Nec mora, nec requies: è Ca[e]saris disciplina.

marginalia.translation: Desire does not rest. Neither delay, nor rest: from the training of Caesar.

position.marginalia_text: Aut viuam lepidè: aut moriar magnificè. Eutrapelus autarces.

marginalia.translation: Either I shall live pleasantly, or I shall die magnificently. The self-sufficiency of Eutrapelus.
